data.title: Meetings — European Malignant Hyperthermia Group
data.text:
The 2025 annual meeting will take place in South Africa at the Boschendal wine estate in Cape Town

The Boschendal wine estate is located in Franschoek, 50 minutes from Cape Town International Airport. It can be reached by Uber from the Airport.

We are pleased to confirm that the 2022 Annual Meeting is to take place as an in-person event. The Leeds MH Group looks forward to welcoming you to Harrogate, a Victorian spa town in beautiful North Yorkshire, famous for its waters, Turkish baths, gardens and tea rooms. The hotel is located in its own gardens in the centre of the town and provides excellent meeting and dining facilities along with 4* accommodation. Registration & on-site accommodation is offered at a very reasonable rate with reductions for students.

The 39th EMHG annual meeting is organised by the Nijmegen NL MH unit.

Because of current travel bans due to Covid-19 it is decided to organize a virtual (only) meeting this year.

The date for the virtual Meeting is May 13-15th;

Three half days: 8.00 AM – 12.00 PM;

Parallel Meetings, free presentations, plenary guest lectures, general EMHG Meeting & award ceremony;

Registration fee: 150€ (including 75€ EMHG-membership fee).

ECMH Nijmegen will send you an invitation and the link to attend the Zoom meetings and Slido codes one week in advance.

We hope to welcome you all at the EMHG digital experience 2021

On behalf of the organizing committee, Marc Snoeck, MH@cwz.nl

On behalf of the board of directors of the European Malignant Hyperthermia Group (EMHG) and the members of the local organizing committee, we are very pleased to welcome you to the 37th annual meeting of the European Malignant Hyperthermia Group which will take place in Ferrara, Italy on May 17th - 19th 2018.

The congress will be held in the center of the small town of Ferrara.

We will certainly try to continue the trend of successful past annual meetings and hope to further contribute to the spirit of friendship and collaboration as known since the first meetings of our group. Indeed the EMHG always stood for close collaboration, an increasingly important asset in facilitating an integrated approach to research in this domain.

We look forward to welcoming you and spending a great time in Ferrara.

Susan Treves Francesco Zorzato Vincenzo Tegazzin

For questions please contact susan.treves@unibas.ch
